p: The ethyl acetate fraction from the leaves of Schismus fasciculatus contained kaempferol, quercetin, and agathist flavone, which showed moderate antibacterial activity against different tested strains (IC 50 0.9 mg/mL) [ 44]. In addition, both cardamom ( Elettaria cardamomum) fruit and seed extracts exerted remarkable antibacterial effect against Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans, Fusobacterium nucleatum, Porphyromonas gingivalis, and Prevotella intermedia [ 45].
